contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{nihongo|'''Kurokawa'''|黒川村|Kurokawa-mura}} was a [[villages of Japan|village]] located in [[Kitakanbara District, Niigata|Kitakanbara District]], [[Niigata Prefecture|Niigata]], [[Japan]]. As of 2003, the village had an estimated [[population]] of 6,577 and a [[population density|density]] of 36.42 persons per km². The total area was 180.60 km². On September 1, 2005 Kurokawa was merged with the town of [[Nakajo, Niigata|Nakajō]], also from [[Kitakanbara District, Niigata|Kitakanbara District]], to form the new city of [[Tainai, Niigata|Tainai]]. Tainai City has a population of approximately 33,000. ==External links== {{Portal|Japan}} * [http://web.archive.org/*/http://www.vill.kurokawa.niigata.jp/ Village of Kurokawa] (Archive) {{ja icon}} * [http://www.city.tainai.niigata.jp/ City of Tainai] {{ja icon}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Niigata Prefecture]] {{Niigata-geo-stub}}
